column4: Hey, guys, I want to resize my home and root partition and create a new partition (going to make a triple boot with GRUB), do I just resize them and then run sudo update-grub from the live cd? I don't know if it will run the utility directly from the usb or...?
anyone?
no need to run update-grub if you are only resizing partitions
I'm going to create a new partition too, I think that would change the UUID of all of the partitions, right?
possibly, can't hurt I guess ;)
would running update-grub already know that I want to update my installation's grub and not the live usb's grub?
you will need to chroot
what's that?
have a websearch and you'l see, you need to change the root where the command is ran so it affects the installed disk
Ok, I have a Ubuntu 10.04 CD, but I have installed Ubuntu 11.04, will update-grub still work and stuff, and can I resize the partition from there?
immediately after inserting it, run:  dmesg | tail   it may give clues
is the drive partitioned?
sure
it came formatted as FAT32, I just formatted it as NTFS
yeah fat32 isn't very robust. Did you safetly remove the device when you last unplugged the device?
yup
good, that cures a billion issues.
http://paste.ubuntu.com/614323/
you missed the pipe to tail, its ok this time but misrunning commands can break your OS
can you manually mount /dev/sdb1 ?
yup, then it comes up. But I was wondering if it will auto mount like my other drives
not sure there dude
